meanings.definition: A long plank balanced in the middle so that two people sitting on opposite ends can move up and down by pushing off the ground.
meanings.sent1: The children played on the seesaws at the park.
meanings.sent2: The seesaws in the playground are painted in bright colors.
meanings.sent3: The seesaws squeaked as the kids went up and down.
meanings.sent4: The seesaws in the schoolyard were like giant teeter-totters.
meanings.sent5: The seesaws creaked with each movement, bringing joy to the children.

meanings.definition: To move up and down or back and forth in a way that resembles the motion of a seesaw.
meanings.sent1: The boat seesaws on the gentle waves of the lake.
meanings.sent2: She seesaws back and forth on the swing in the park.
meanings.sent3: The seesawing motion of the swing made her giggle.
meanings.sent4: His emotions seesawed between excitement and nervousness.
meanings.sent5: The seesawing branches in the wind created a calming rhythm.
